extendedIngredients.name: onions
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 large onions, cut into large wedges

extendedIngredients.name: thyme
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 sprigs thyme, plus extra leaves for sprinkling

recipes.title: Creamy chicken soup

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. One wine you could try is CalNaturale Chardonnay Lodi. It has 4.1 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 11 dollars.

productMatches.title: CalNaturale Chardonnay Lodi
productMatches.description: Complexity and intensity define this Chardonnay. The nose is full of citrus, green apple and pear with floral overtones. The flavors are rich on entry with lively fruit in the mid palate and a long fruity, warm finish.

recipes.instructions: Put the chicken thighs in a very large,heavy-based pan and fry for a few mins,turning frequently to lightly colour them.Providing the heat is low, there is noneed to add any oil. Pour in the wine,turn up the heat and boil rapidly toevaporate the alcohol. Pile in the vegand herbs, add 1 tsp salt and the whitepepper (or you can use black pepper).Pour in 2 litres boiling water. Cover thepan and simmer for 45 mins until thechicken and veg are tender. Take out thebay leaves and thyme sprigs and coolfor about 30 mins.Remove chicken from the soup, thenstrip the meat from the bones. Put allbut 140g of the chicken back into thepan. Blitz the soup with a hand blenderor in batches in a food processor untilvery smooth, then return to the pan.Blend the flour and cream togetherwith a couple of ladles of the soup, thenstir the creamy mixture into the rest ofthe soup and heat, stirring continuouslyuntil thickened. You can blitz again if itlooks a little lumpy. Chop the remainingchicken and stir into the soup. Scatterwith thyme leaves, to serve.

steps.step: Put the chicken thighs in a very large,heavy-based pan and fry for a few mins,turning frequently to lightly colour them.Providing the heat is low, there is noneed to add any oil.
Pour in the wine,turn up the heat and boil rapidly toevaporate the alcohol. Pile in the vegand herbs, add 1 tsp salt and the whitepepper (or you can use black pepper).
Pour in 2 litres boiling water. Cover thepan and simmer for 45 mins until thechicken and veg are tender. Take out thebay leaves and thyme sprigs and coolfor about 30 mins.

Remove chicken from the soup, thenstrip the meat from the bones. Put allbut 140g of the chicken back into thepan. Blitz the soup with a hand blenderor in batches in a food processor untilvery smooth, then return to the pan.Blend the flour and cream togetherwith a couple of ladles of the soup, thenstir the creamy mixture into the rest ofthe soup and heat, stirring continuouslyuntil thickened. You can blitz again if itlooks a little lumpy. Chop the remainingchicken and stir into the soup. Scatterwith thyme leaves, to serve.
